Classic WoW launched on November 23, 2004 in North America.
Mounts were level 40 and extremely expensive.
Epic mounts cost 1000 gold before reputation discounts.
Gold was genuinely hard to earn.
Hunters had dead zones between melee and ranged.
Hunters had to feed pets to keep them happy.
Soul shards only stacked to one.
Warlocks had to farm shards before raids.
Soulstones worked only on party members, not raids.
Dying repeatedly could cost you serious time.
Corpse runs were terrifying in hostile zones.
Boats and zeppelins could kill you.
Missing a boat could cost 15+ minutes.
You had to physically run to dungeon entrances.
Meeting stones were cosmetic at launch.
Dungeon groups formed entirely in chat.
Shadow Priests were considered meme specs.
Feral Druids were niche but clutch.
Fire Mages were raid-only early on.
Pulling aggro often meant instant death.
Bosses didn’t have clear mechanics indicators.
Most mechanics were learned by wiping.
Organizing 40 humans was harder than the raid.
Molten Core had no attunement skip.
You had to run through Blackrock Depths.
Onyxia attunement was a multi-step questline.
Horde and Alliance had different Ony attunements.
The Ony quest involved espionage and disguise.
Priests were forced to stop healing.
Warriors were forced into Berserker stance.
Hunters could wipe raids with mispulls.
Casters needed to stand still to cast.
Trading kills at the same time was common.
Fear sent you running into more mobs.
Sap didn’t work on all humanoids.
Mobs could flee at low HP.
Low-level mobs could still kill you.
Running out of mana was constant.
Mages made water for the group.
Rallying Cry of the Dragonslayer was broken.
Losing buffs on death was devastating.
People logged out to preserve buffs.
PvP servers made buff runs dangerous.
Southshore vs Tarren Mill was legendary.
There were no battleground queues initially.
Grand Marshal and High Warlord gear was elite.
Alterac Valley could last hours or days.
AV had NPCs, quests, and turn-ins.
Summoning Ivus/Lokholar was a big deal.
Queue times varied wildly by faction.
Devilsaur sets were BiS for melee.
Talent respec costs increased each time.
Raid bosses weren’t instanced per group.
Some bosses were bugged for months.
C’Thun was mathematically impossible at launch.
Miss chance existed vs higher-level mobs.
Players farmed gear just to survive.
Logging in felt like entering a world.
WoW Classic shaped MMO culture forever.
People still chase that feeling today.
